steps.title: Keep the crawfish in the sack they arrive in if you are not going to cook them right away.
steps.content: Keep the crawfish in the sack they arrive in if you are not going to cook them right away. Crawfish will die if stored in water for too long, so leave them in the air.

steps.title: To store them for longer, briefly hose them down with water and place them in a container with ice.
steps.content: To store them for longer, briefly hose them down with water and place them in a container with ice. Live crawfish can be kept at 36ºF to 46ºF for a few days. Drain them as needed, so you aren't leaving them submerged in water. [1] X Research source Be sure to remove the ice and let the crawfish return to room temperature before purging and cooking.

steps.title: Take the live crawfish out of the sack and put them into a large plastic tub or cooler.
steps.content: Take the live crawfish out of the sack and put them into a large plastic tub or cooler. Make sure your container has enough room to thoroughly clean them. Also make sure they won't be able to somehow crawl out.

steps.title: Pour salt over the crawfish in the tub.
steps.content: Pour salt over the crawfish in the tub. Take your salt box or grinder and shake it liberally over them. Regular table salt will do—this isn't intended for seasoning. The bugs should go wild with discomfort when you do this. Salting is optional. Some cooks believe that salting may help clean the crawfish better by compelling them to essentially vomit and purge any mud and waste in their digestive system. However it also increases the risk of killing the crawfish during the purge.

steps.title: Use large instrument to stir them up and then salt them again.
steps.content: Use large instrument to stir them up and then salt them again. You want to try to salt the whole batch evenly.

steps.title: Pour fresh water over the live crawfish until they are just submerged.
steps.content: Pour fresh water over the live crawfish until they are just submerged. You can use another bucket or just fill their tub up with a hose. When this happens, the crawfish spit out the grime in their system, minimizing fishy taste and odors and reducing the size of their gritty sand vein.

steps.title: Stir gently with a large instrument for about 3 minutes.
steps.content: Stir gently with a large instrument for about 3 minutes. The moving water will help wash the mud off the crawfish's shells and gills.

steps.title: Pour out the salt water, keeping your crawfish in their tub.
steps.content: Pour out the salt water, keeping your crawfish in their tub. Try to drain the salt water completely.

steps.title: Refill the tub with new fresh water, and stir.
steps.content: Refill the tub with new fresh water, and stir. Check for any dead crawfish that float to the top—remove them and throw them away immediately.

steps.title: Rinse them one more time.
steps.content: Rinse them one more time. After giving it a stir, the water should be much less grimy than in previous rinses. If you are satisfied with the cleanliness, you are done purging.

steps.title: Drain the water and proceed to boil your crawfish.
steps.content: Drain the water and proceed to boil your crawfish.

steps.title: If you choose not to use salt, simply fill up the tub with water and let the crawfish sit in the water for 5 to 10 minutes.
steps.content: If you choose not to use salt, simply fill up the tub with water and let the crawfish sit in the water for 5 to 10 minutes. You can give them an occasional stir to help loose dirt and grime.

steps.title: Pour out the grimy water and refill the tub with new fresh water.
steps.content: Pour out the grimy water and refill the tub with new fresh water. Let the live crawfish sit for another 5 to 10 minutes.

steps.title: Check for dead crawfish floating on the top and remove them immediately.
steps.content: Check for dead crawfish floating on the top and remove them immediately. Crawfish are best if you boil them live. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Drain the container again and fill it one more time.
steps.content: Drain the container again and fill it one more time. Give them a last stir and check the muddiness of the water. It should be reasonably clear now.

steps.title: Drain the water and boil your mud bugs!
steps.content: Drain the water and boil your mud bugs!
